meanings.definition: The quality or state of being thin or slender.
meanings.sent1: The tenuity of the spider's web made it almost invisible.
meanings.sent2: She admired the tenuity of the model's figure.
meanings.sent3: The tenuity of the thread was no match for the playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The tenuity of the ice was a sign of the coming thaw.
meanings.sent5: The tenuity of the branches allowed the sunlight to filter through.

meanings.sent1: The tenuity of the fog obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The tenuity of the fabric made it unsuitable for winter wear.
meanings.sent3: The tenuity of the soup surprised the hungry guests.
meanings.sent4: The tenuity of the crowd made it easy to navigate the festival.
meanings.sent5: The tenuity of the air at high altitudes can cause breathing difficulties.

meanings.definition: The quality of being rare or scarce.
meanings.sent1: The tenuity of the gemstone made it highly valuable.
meanings.sent2: The tenuity of the resource led to strict conservation measures.
meanings.sent3: The tenuity of the ingredient made the dish a delicacy.
meanings.sent4: The tenuity of the antique coin made it a prized possession.
meanings.sent5: The tenuity of the flower species made it a rare find for botanists.
